interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Elf (DVD) Review Date: 2015/11/25 Store: Jon Favreau (Director), Leon Redbone (Actor), Will Ferrell (Actor) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Holidays & Seasonal, Christmas, Comedy Product Description: ['Product Description', "This hilarious Christmas film tells the tale of a young orphan child who mistakenly crawls into Santa's bag of gifts on Christmas Eve and is transported back to the North Pole and raised as an elf. Years later Buddy learns he is not really an elf and goes on a journey to New York City to find his true identity.", 'DVD Features:', 'Audio Commentary:', '2 commentaries with Will Ferrell & Director', 'DVD ROM Features', 'Deleted Scenes', 'Featurette:', 'Film school for kids Tag along with Will Ferrell How they made the North Pole Kids on Christmas and more!', 'Amazon.com', 'Elf', 'is genuinely good. Not just', 'Saturday Night Live', '-movie good, when the movie has some funny bits but is basically an insult to humanity;', 'Elf', 'is a smartly written, skillfully directed, and deftly acted story of a human being adopted by Christmas elves who returns to the human world to find his father. And because the writing, directing, and acting are all genuinely good,', 'Elf', 'is also genuinely funny. Will Ferrell, as Buddy the adopted elf, is hysterically sincere. James Caan, as his rediscovered father, executes his surly dumbfoundedness with perfect aplomb. Zooey Deschanel, as a department store worker with whom Buddy falls in love, is adorably sardonic. Director Jon Favreau (', 'Swingers', ") shepherds the movie through all the obligatory Christmas cliches and focuses on material that's sometimes subtle and consistently surprising. Frankly,", 'Elf', 'feels miraculous. Also featuring Mary Steenburgen, Bob Newhart, Peter Dinklage, and Ed Asner as Santa Claus.', '--Bret Fetzer'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.3 x 7.5 inches; 6.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'NEWL7168DVD', 'Director': 'Jon Favreau', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 35 minutes', 'Release date': 'October 24, 2006', 'Actors': 'Leon Redbone, Will Ferrell, James Caan, Ray Harryhausen, Zooey Deschanel', 'Dubbed': 'Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, Korean, French, Thai, Portuguese, Spanish, Indonesian', 'Producers': 'Jon Berg, Toby Emmerich, Kent Alterman, Todd Komarnicki, Cale Boyter', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround)', 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Writers': 'David Berenbaum', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Review Text: While I am not a huge Will Ferrel fan, I do love this movie.
It is a lot of fun to watch. No one seems to run it until super late in the holiday season, so we finally bought it.

I'd never heard of "Infinifilm" before, so wasn't sure what to expect.
Basically, after you watch the movie in regular mode first, you can watch it afterwards in "Infinifilm" mode.
There are popup links on the bottom of the screen which can be clicked on, which take you into more detail about certain aspects of the movie itself. We've been trying out a few of them, and they are fun for movie buffs or anyone interested in the behind-the-scenes information.

The only thing that didn't make much sense about it was that we bought a brand new DVD, but the Infinifilm part refers to something being on "Disc 2". There was only ONE disc in the package. So, not sure what the scoop is on that one.

I believe this is a fun addition to everyone's holiday viewing movie collection. Good old fashioned holiday fun.
No worries about those who do not like the religious aspect - there is nothing mentioned in here on that one.
And the nice part about owning the movie is that you get to see the entire thing, instead of whatever scenes the tv stations have decided to show you. We have seen this movie several times on tv over the last few years, but with the DVD, we've seen quite a few smaller scenes that were never included in the tv versions. (And one of my favorite parts that we've used at our house is the big cola belch, followed by "did you hear that?" Haha!

Fun for the family, nothing dirty, no visible nudity, just holiday entertainment. Review Title: Two thumbs up for a really fun holiday movie Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Standard Deviants School - Basic Math, Program 7 - Fraction Basics (Classroom Edition) Standard Deviants School (Actor) Rated: Unrated Format: DVD Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Special Interests ['The Standard Deviants set the groundwork for learning fractions. They cover fraction terms, common factors, and reducing fractions. Everything you need to start working with fractions!'] {'MPAA rating': 'Unrated (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Media Format': 'NTSC, Multiple Formats, Color', 'Run time': '7 minutes', 'Release date': 'July 15, 2004', 'Actors': 'Standard Deviants School', 'Studio': 'Cerebellum Corp', 'Number of discs': '1'} Well, I had heard that the Standard Deviants items had changed a lot after being purchased by
a new company. This is apparently very true!

NEVER, NEVER, NEVER pay the full price for one of these DVD's. By that, I mean if you pay over $10
total, you'll feel a little ripped off.

Apparently, what the new owners have done is take their basic instruction and break it down into
infinitesimal sections in order to sell more DVD's. If you think this will give your child a good
overview of fractions, you will be disappointed.

The DVD itself was fine. Mine had little lines across the bottom, but I suspect that might have been
because this was for a regular screen and I have a widescreen, but not sure.

What is un-be-freakin-lievable is that this DVD is only SEVEN MINUTES long! Yup - infomercials are longer.
What this DOES do is introduce the CONCEPT of fractions. It explains what a fraction is, what numerators
and denominators are, how to get a common denominator (but that isn't explained well, IMHO. As an adult, it was
easy, but if a kid was watching this, I am not so sure they would really get it). It also explained equivalent
fractions (as in, why 1/3, 2/6 and 4/12 are all basically the same fraction of 1/3). It shows via pie charts
which might help a child visualize hat they are talking about with a fraction.

But, that is where the instruction ends. Abruptly.
It does not show how to multiply fractions, which was the "fraction basic" info that I was hoping for
when I purchased this DVD.

All in all, this was disappointing. I'd bought 3 SD Math Basic DVD's, and really wasn't looking at the length.
NONE of the newer DVD's run very long, and are apparently broken into so many sub-sets of information that you'll
end up having to buy a lot of their DVD's (and they hope spending a lot of money) to get all the basic information.
This shows a real greedy side to the company, in my opinion. Just make a DVD about fractions, period.
Don't make me buy 2 or 3 of the DVD's to get good fraction information for a child who is having a rough
time with the fraction concept.

This is better than nothing, but that's all. You could make your own pie charts at home just as effectively,
or use cookies laid out in a clock format, etc, something that kids can relate to. The only benefit to this short
DVD is that the kid can watch it any time s/he wants to without your being involved.
Don't pay full price for these, because it definitely isn't worth it. Great for what it is... Valentine's Day Bradley Cooper (Actor), Jennifer Garner (Actor), Garry Marshall (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG-13 Format: DVD Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Warner Home Video, All Titles ['Product Description', 'The starriest cast you may ever see sparkles in a hilarious and heartwarming romcom from the director of Pretty Woman and The Princess Diaries. Stories crisscross, collide and boomerang in this look at a day in the life of love. There\'s a proposal. Flowers that didn\'t get sent. A big fat secret that\'s finally told. The "I\'ll show up and surprise him" that ended up surprising her. Fights, kisses, wrong turns, right moves and more. Whether new to or through with love, you\'ll fall in love with this 19-star, funny-side-up celebration of romance.', 'Amazon.com', "For those in love with love--and even for those who think they're jaded and over it--", "Valentine's Day", "and its superb cast are the uplifting elixir that's called for. Director Garry Marshall must have called in every favor he had in Hollywood to line up this amazing cast. Much as Robert Altman does in his best films, Marshall follows intertwining and intersecting couples around Los Angeles as they hook up, break up, and act up as Valentine's Day--with all its intense expectations--looms. Bradley Cooper plays one half of a couple struggling to get back on track. Julia Roberts plays an army officer en route from Iraq (!) to visit a lover halfway around the world. Jennifer Garner is appealing as the girlfriend of a cad (Patrick Dempsey), who managed to overlook telling her he was married; will Garner's character go all", 'Fatal Attraction', "? Standouts include the always-charming Anne Hathaway, whose character supplements her income with a freelance gig that, shall we say, involves using multiple accents over the phone--much to the consternation of her beau, played by Topher Grace. Shirley MacLaine and Hector Elizondo play a long-married couple whose strong marriage may be rocked by an old and very inconvenient truth. And young stars Emma Roberts, Taylor Lautner, and Taylor Swift sparkle enough to draw in younger viewers. And if love doesn't always go as planned for these couples (and singles), it's Marshall's deftness as a director that keeps the scenes moving along crisply to the next lovers, or victims. Marshall seems to be aiming to achieve for Valentine's Day what Richard Curtis did for Christmas in", 'Love Actually', '--and if he falls a little short, it\'s not due to any lack of star power or onscreen dazzle. "Love is the only shocking act left on the planet!" exclaims Ashton Kutcher\'s character. If so, viewers of', "Valentine's Day", 'can expect to be shocked--into a warm romance with this, yes, valentine to love. --', 'A.T. Hurley'] {'Genre': 'Drama/Love & Romance, Comedy', 'Format': 'Color, Multiple Formats, AC-3, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Dubbed, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Taylor Swift, Jamie Foxx, Jessica Alba, Taylor Lautner, Julia Roberts, Anne Hathaway, Garry Marshall, Jessica Biel, Jennifer Garner, Bradley Cooper, Kathy BatesTaylor Swift, Jamie Foxx, Jessica Alba, Taylor Lautner, Julia Roberts, Anne Hathaway, Garry Marshall, Jessica Biel, Jennifer Garner, Bradley Cooper, Kathy Bates See more', 'Language': 'Unqualified', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 5 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.25 x 5.75 x 0.25 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'NEWL1000117450DVD', 'Director': 'Garry Marshall', 'Media Format': 'Color, Multiple Formats, AC-3, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Dubbed, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 5 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 18, 2010', 'Actors': 'Bradley Cooper, Jennifer Garner, Taylor Swift, Jamie Foxx, Jessica Alba', 'Dubbed': 'French, Portuguese, Spanish', 'Studio': 'New Line Cinema', 'Number of discs': '1'} Okay, I HAD to see this movie.
Valentine's Day is my favorite holiday.
I love romantic comedies.
Then all the cast - geez, so many stars!

But, the movie was a little boring, to be honest.
I liked it, and yes, I'd watch it again, but it doesn't have any
of the staying power (Ie - want to watch repeatedly) of movies like
"Sleepless in Seattle". They could have done SO much more with the stories.
I would have loved to have the movie be longer and more interesting.

If you can get it really cheaply, or collect movies with a certain star
in them, then go ahead. Otherwise, wait for a sidewalk sale or penny sale!
Shame on the director for doing so little with so much! For so many stars, it's a little slow Harry and the Hendersons Don Ameche (Actor), Orene Anderson (Actor), William Dear (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG Format: DVD Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD ['John Lithgow takes adventure to new heights in this big-laughs, big-hearted, big-footed comedy for the whole family! A chance car accident introduces the Hendersons to the real-life Bigfoot, who is anything but a ferocious monster and quickly becomes a true friend to the family. They\'re soon in a race against the clock to return "Harry" to his natural environment before the authorities capture him. The fur will fly in this feel-good romp—an Oscar winner for Best Makeup—the whole family will enjoy again and again!Bonus Content:', 'Feature Commentary with Director William Dear', 'Feature Commentary with Director William Dear', 'Deleted Scenes', 'Deleted Scenes', 'Harry...Finding the Missing Link', 'Harry...Finding the Missing Link', 'Making of the Harry and the Hendersons', 'Making of the Harry and the Hendersons', 'Newswrap', 'Newswrap', 'Theatrical Trailer', 'Theatrical Trailer'] {'Genre': 'Harry & the Hendersons, Kids & Family/7-9 Years, Kids & Family, DVD Movie, Blu-ray Movie, Comedy, Kids & Family/10-12 YearsHarry & the Hendersons, Kids & Family/7-9 Years, Kids & Family, DVD Movie, Blu-ray Movie, Comedy, Kids & Family/10-12 Years See more', 'Format': 'AC-3, Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Original recording remastered, Widescreen, Subtitled, Special EditionAC-3, Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Original recording remastered, Widescreen, Subtitled, Special Edition See more', 'Contributor': 'Richard Arnold, Jacqueline Moscou, Lainie Kazan, Melinda Dillon, Kevin Peter Hall, Laura Kenny, David Suchet, Sean Morgan, John Lithgow, David Richards, William Dear, Margaret Langrick, M. Emmet Walsh, Peggy Platt, Don Ameche, Bill Ontiverous, Joshua Rudoy, Orene Anderson, David MacIntyre, Nick FlynnRichard Arnold, Jacqueline Moscou, Lainie Kazan, Melinda Dillon, Kevin Peter Hall, Laura Kenny, David Suchet, Sean Morgan, John Lithgow, David Richards, William Dear, Margaret Langrick, M. Emmet Walsh, Peggy Platt, Don Ameche, Bill Ontiverous, Joshua Rudoy, Oren… See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Unqualified (DTS ES 6.1)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 51 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.75 x 0.5 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Item model number': '25195003506', 'Director': 'William Dear', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Original recording remastered, Widescreen, Subtitled, Special Edition', 'Run time': '1 hour and 51 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 24, 2007', 'Actors': 'Don Ameche, Orene Anderson, Richard Arnold, Melinda Dillon, Nick Flynn', 'Subtitles': 'French, Spanish', 'Studio': 'Universal Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} What's not to love here?

This is a funny movie about an average guy encountering Bigfoot.
Totally plausible, right?
I got this for my daughter, because she loves Bigfoot.

It is full of laugh-out-loud moments, and belongs in everyone's comedy movie collection! Definitely a good comedy movie Office Space - Special Edition with Flair (Widescreen Edition) Ron Livingston (Actor), Jennifer Aniston (Actor), Mike Judge (Director, Writer) & 0 more Rated: R Format: DVD Movies & TV, Fully Loaded DVDs, Special Editions ['Product Description', 'Unable to endure another mind-numbing day at Initech Corporation, cubicle slave Peter Gibbons gets fired up and decides to get fired. Direction: Mike Judge, Actors: Jennifer Aniston, John C. McGinley, Richard Riehle, Ron Livingston. Special Features: Out of the Office - An Office Space Retrospective with Mike Judge; Deleted Scenes. Widescreen, 1.85:1, 5.1 Surround, Language: English / Sub. English, Spanish Year: 1999 Runtime: 90 minutes.', 'Amazon.com', 'Stills from', 'Office Space', '(Click for larger image)'] {'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'Dolby, Closed-captioned, Multiple Formats, Color, Special Edition, Dubbed, Subtitled, NTSC, WidescreenDolby, Closed-captioned, Multiple Formats, Color, Special Edition, Dubbed, Subtitled, NTSC, Widescreen See more', 'Contributor': 'John C. McGinley, Ron Livingston, Mike Judge, Richard Riehle, Stephen Root, David Herman, Jennifer Aniston, Diedrich Bader, Gary Cole, Paul Willson, Alexandra Wentworth, Ajay Naidu, Joe BaysJohn C. McGinley, Ron Livingston, Mike Judge, Richard Riehle, Stephen Root, David Herman, Jennifer Aniston, Diedrich Bader, Gary Cole, Paul Willson, Alexandra Wentworth, Ajay Naidu, Joe Bays See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Unqualified, French (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), Spanish (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround)', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 29 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.4 x 7.5 inches; 2.08 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'MFR024543160892#VG', 'Director': 'Mike Judge', 'Media Format': 'Dolby, Closed-captioned, Multiple Formats, Color, Special Edition, Dubbed, Subtitled, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 29 minutes', 'Release date': 'November 1, 2005', 'Actors': 'Ron Livingston, Jennifer Aniston, David Herman, Ajay Naidu, Diedrich Bader', 'Dubbed': 'English, French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish', 'Studio': '20th Century Studios', 'Writers': 'Mike Judge', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} Very cute movie. Of course, I find it even more entertaining, since we were living in Houston during the whole Enron/Arthur Andersen debacle. If you've ever worked in a cube farm situation for a faceless corporation, then you'll truly relate to and enjoy this movie.

I had already seen it many, many times. We bought it because my daughter needed to see it for a class assignment, and no one had it playing.
I was surprised to see who was actually playing Milton! I'll leave that for you to find out.

Overall, funny movie, not too raunchy, and a fun way to spend a couple hours trying to not think about your own job. Definitely worth watching. Completely relatable for all cube farm workers {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Español'], 'Directors': ['Pamela Fryman', 'Rob Greenberg', 'Michael J. Shea', 'Neil Patrick Harris'], 'Producers': ['Pamela Fryman', 'Carter Bays', 'Craig Thomas', 'Suzy Mamann-Greenberg', 'Stewart Halpern-Fingerhut', 'Chris Harris', 'Stephen Lloyd'], 'Starring': ['Josh Radnor', 'Jason Segel', 'Cobie Smulders'], 'Studio': ['CBS']} What's not to love?
THis was our first dip into the Amazon Prime video, and I loved being able to see all the episodes for no additional charges. If you love the series, you'll love the Prime viewing too! How I Met Your Mother: Season 5 Jason Segel (Actor), Neil Patrick Harris (Actor) Rated: NR Format: DVD Movies & TV, Studio Specials, 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment, Fox TV, General ['Product Description', '', 'Suit up for the hilarious Season Five of', 'How I Met Your Mother,', 'the outrageous, Emmy-nominated hit starring Neil Patrick Harris, Jason Segel and Alyson Hannigan! \xa0The show’s funniest season to date is loaded with hook-ups, break-ups, and the return of Slapsgiving— not to mention the hottest guest stars imaginable, including Jennifer Lopez, Carrie Underwood, and Rachel Bilson. \xa0On the dating front, Barney and Robin take their relationship to the next level—before calling it off—and Ted meets the roommate of his future wife in this uproarious, modern-day love story told in reverse.', 'Amazon.com', 'How I Met Your Mother', 'excels in tossed-off bits of genius, from a saccharine book-on-tape read by Kenny Rogers to "But, uhm" to bagpipes to harmonizing with Will Shortz and Peter Bogdanovich. These little gems of comic absurdity perfectly complement the sitcom\'s other great strength, which is clever, twisty storytelling--plots that fold back into themselves, unfold in flashbacks, or cross-reference previous episodes. This narrative inventiveness is hardly surprising, given that the premise of the entire series is that it\'s being told by the future central character, Ted Mosby, to his two children, gradually revealing how he came to marry their mother.', 'By the fifth season, this premise is growing a little bit threadbare (particularly after some of the red herrings of the past two seasons), yet the show continues to hold abundant pleasures. The cast--Josh Radnor, Cobie Smulders, Alyson Hannigan, Jason Segel, and Neil Patrick Harris--have an effortless lock on their characters, allowing them to pull off some perilously goofy bits that, in less confident hands, could have foundered (a musical homage to wearing suits, for example). The writing is crisp and driven; this half-hour sitcom crams in more plot turns than your average hour-long drama. The fifth season is not good to start with--the humor is much, much stronger if you\'ve grown to love these characters over the previous four seasons--but for everyone who\'s been following Ted, Robin, Marshall, Lily, and Barney, it\'s essential viewing. Some surprising moments of melancholy are completely earned and stand out from the typical sitcom overreaching for "significance"; these moments are successfully rooted in the characters, who become more real every season… yes, even Barney.', '--Bret Fetzer'] {'Genre': 'Comedy/Television', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, AC-3, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Cobie Smulders, Josh Radnor, Neil Patrick Harris, Alyson Hannigan, Jason Segel', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), French (Dolby Surround), Spanish (Dolby Surround), Unqualified', 'Runtime': '9 hours and 18 minutes', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.81 Ounces', 'Item model number': '7759426', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, AC-3, Widescreen', 'Run time': '9 hours and 18 minutes', 'Release date': 'September 21, 2010', 'Actors': 'Jason Segel, Neil Patrick Harris, Josh Radnor, Alyson Hannigan, Cobie Smulders', 'Subtitles': 'French, Spanish, English', 'Studio': '20th Century Fox', 'Number of discs': '3'} Love it! I have three seasons left to collect, but I'll get there.

Thank you for quick shipment and discs are in good condition.
This is one of my favorite seasons as well - the episodes are interesting and fun.
Definitely on the must-have list for HIMYM fans. Great season - must have for fans! Director Jon Favreau (', 'Swingers', ") shepherds the movie through all the obligatory Christmas cliches and focuses on material that's sometimes subtle and consistently surprising. Also featuring Mary Steenburgen, Bob Newhart, Peter Dinklage, and Ed Asner as Santa Claus.', '--Bret Fetzer'] {'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.3 x 7.5 inches; 6.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'NEWL7168DVD', 'Director': 'Jon Favreau', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Anamorphic, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 35 minutes', 'Release date': 'October 24, 2006', 'Actors': 'Leon Redbone, Will Ferrell, James Caan, Ray Harryhausen, Zooey Deschanel', 'Dubbed': 'Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, Korean, French, Thai, Portuguese, Spanish, Indonesian', 'Producers': 'Jon Berg, Toby Emmerich, Kent Alterman, Todd Komarnicki, Cale Boyter', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround)', 'Studio': 'WarnerBrothers', 'Writers': 'David Berenbaum', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} While I am not a huge Will Ferrel fan, I do love this movie.
It is a lot of fun to watch. No one seems to run it until super late in the holiday season, so we finally bought it.

I'd never heard of "Infinifilm" before, so wasn't sure what to expect.
Basically, after you watch the movie in regular mode first, you can watch it afterwards in "Infinifilm" mode.
There are popup links on the bottom of the screen which can be clicked on, which take you into more detail about certain aspects of the movie itself. We've been trying out a few of them, and they are fun for movie buffs or anyone interested in the behind-the-scenes information.

The only thing that didn't make much sense about it was that we bought a brand new DVD, but the Infinifilm part refers to something being on "Disc 2". There was only ONE disc in the package. So, not sure what the scoop is on that one.

I believe this is a fun addition to everyone's holiday viewing movie collection. Good old fashioned holiday fun.
No worries about those who do not like the religious aspect - there is nothing mentioned in here on that one.
And the nice part about owning the movie is that you get to see the entire thing, instead of whatever scenes the tv stations have decided to show you. We have seen this movie several times on tv over the last few years, but with the DVD, we've seen quite a few smaller scenes that were never included in the tv versions. (And one of my favorite parts that we've used at our house is the big cola belch, followed by "did you hear that?" Haha!

Fun for the family, nothing dirty, no visible nudity, just holiday entertainment. Two thumbs up for a really fun holiday movie
profile:
**User Summary:**

- **Educational Focus:** The user appreciates educational materials that teach concepts clearly and engagingly, particularly for children struggling with subjects like fractions. They seek resources that offer comprehensive coverage and depth for effective learning support.
- **Value-Conscious:** They prioritize value in purchases and remain skeptical toward full-priced items, concerned about commercial exploitation in educational offerings and entertainment. They prefer content without additional charges, favoring subscription or bundled access.
- **Expectation Management:** Disappointment arises from products lacking depth; they value thorough explanations over fragmented content and favor innovative learning tools that extend beyond traditional methods.
- **Skeptical of Edutainment:** The user criticizes the trend of fragmenting educational content into costly segments, favoring comprehensive and engaging materials instead.
- **Mixed Reviews on Quality:** They maintain a discerning evaluation of content based on depth and substance, acknowledging quality while being critical.
- **Entertainment Preferences:** Recently, the user purchased a family-friendly comedy for holiday viewing, indicating a preference for fun and engaging films that can be enjoyed repeatedly with family. They enjoy romantic comedies and family-oriented comedies, particularly those with relatable narratives. They are cautious about spending full price and appreciate DVDs that offer complete content rather than edited broadcasts. Their commitment to quality storytelling and unique content reflects a deeper engagement with the media they consume, ensuring their entertainment choices align with their preferences for depth and enjoyment.
